page.title: 07Cropping in Evie
page.content: Ploughing begins in January and the land is ready for sewing by March or April. Barley or Grass-seed is usually sewn. A well treated field of grass will last from 7 to 12 years before ploughing and reseeding. Slurry and chemical fertilizers are increasingly used to ensure a high crop yield. The main fodder crop is silage with some farms taking 2 cuts, one in early June and one in early August. Other farms cut once in late June. Orkney's climate is more suited to silage than hay although some farms supplement their main crop with hay. In September the barley is harvested A combine and driver is usually hired. In winter the propcorned barley is bruised, mixed with minerals and fed to the cattle along with silage. The barley straw is used for feeding or bedding.
